item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.

item.title: 東京 | Tokyo
item.description: Location: library(leaflet) library(ggmap) location=geocode( "Tokyo" ) ## Warning in readLines(connect, warn = FALSE): InternetOpenUrl failed: 'The ## connection with the server was reset' ## Warning in geocode("Tokyo"): geocoding failed for "Tokyo". ## if accompanied by 500 Internal Server Error with using dsk, try google. m <- leaflet()%>% addTiles() %>% # Add default OpenStreetMap map tiles setView(lng=location$lon, lat=location$lat, zoom = 05) %>% addMarkers(lng=location$lon, lat=location$lat, popup="Tokyo") ## Warning in validateCoords(lng, lat, funcName): Data contains 1 rows with ## either missing or invalid lat/lon values and will be ignored m {"
